title: Understanding TBI
text: A traumatic brain injury (TBI) is a complex injury with a broad spectrum of symptoms and disabilities. It can affect various aspects of a person's life.

title: Causes of TBI
text: TBIs can result from a blow, bump, or jolt to the head, or a penetrating head injury that disrupts the normal function of the brain.

title: Symptoms of TBI
text: Symptoms of a TBI can include headaches, confusion, dizziness, blurred vision, and changes in behavior or mood.

hintAnswer: a brain injury that can cause $$short-$$ or $$long-term$$ problems with thinking, physical movement, communication, and functional abilities
title: Defining TBI
text: Based on the information provided, how would you define a traumatic brain injury (TBI)?
choices: a brain injury that can cause $$short-$$ or $$long-term$$ problems with thinking, physical movement, communication, and functional abilities
>a minor injury that does not affect brain function
>a condition that only affects physical movement
